text:
I use the rhino javascript library in my application.  Rhino has features which
allow it to utilize any java classes and packages it has access to.  In Tomcat,
however, rhino (which I included as js.jar in the /lib directory of my
application) can't seem to see my individual classes (which are in my /classes
directory).
creator: xgeoff@yahoo.com
xgeoff@yahoo.com
text:
I have been doing a lot of troubleshooting on this and I believe it is a 
classloader issue.  According to the hierarchy in the tomcat users guide, the 
webapp classloader should be used for all classes in the WEB-INF/classes 
directory as well as for the jarred classes in the WEB-INF/lib directory. The 
jarred classes (in this case js.jar) do not appear to be using the same 
classloader as my other classes.  And, in fact, the classloader that the js.jar 
files are using is incapable of seeing my classes.

creator: sriramnrn@gmail.com
text:
You're right. See
http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-3.3-doc/tomcat-ug.html#configuring_classes for
more information.
